component.description:
The tableFormLayout lays out input form controls, such that their labels and fields line up vertically. The children of this component are input controls, they are inputText, inputHidden, inputFile, inputColor, inputListOfValues, inputDate, selectBooleanCheckBox, selectBooleanRadio, selectOneChoice, selectOneListBox, selectOneRadio, selectManyListBox and panelLabelAndMessage.
This component uses style and contentStyle properties of the inner components to calculate and set width and height styling attributes. The objective of doing this is make more easy the elaboration of complex forms.
This component has 2 modes of operation based on percentWidth property If the property is set to false, width and hspace properties are readed as pixels, and all layout is calculated according to these two properties. When percentWidth is set to true, width and hspace properties are readed as percent values, so the horizontal size is calculated as a percent of the parent container.
The tableFormLayout component also supports the group component in its footer facet so you can place more than one item in the footer. You can even group footer items one additional time to get separators to appear.

facet.description:
This facet is rendered under the columns and usually contains a panelButtonBar.

This facet may not always line up perfectly, especially if the labels or fields are longer than expected. Try adjusting things with the labelWidth and fieldWidth attributes when necessary. Also, the columns attribute on inputText may be helpful.

property.description: Define the available rows and distribution. If this property is defined, height property must be set, because the calculations are based on height. Example 1*,2*,100,100 . If there is a * after a number, this is a relative value, if not is an absolute pixel value.

Define the available columns and distribution. If this property is defined, width property must be set, because the calculations are based on width. Example 1*,2*,100,100 . If there is a * after a number, this is a relative value, if not is an absolute pixel value. No absolute values should be set if percentWidth=true .
width of the panel. If percentWidth=false(default) is a measure in pixels, if percentWidth=true is a percent (0-100) value relative to the container.
Horizontal space between cells (if percentWidth=false is in pixels, if percentWidth=true is a percent value).
Define the mode of horizontal measures are calculated. false(default) is absolute(pixels) mode. true is percent mode.

component-extension.mfp:long-description: <html:p> The tableFormLayout lays out input form controls, such that their labels and fields line up vertically. </html:p> <html:p> Usually, this component will simply contain labelled Apache Trinidad input components in its main content - these are inputText, inputFile, inputColor, inputListOfValues, inputDate, selectBooleanCheckbox, selectBooleanRadio, selectOneChoice, selectOneListbox, selectOneRadio, selectManyCheckbox, and selectManyListbox. These components must have their "simple" attribute set to false, which is the default, and will cause the labels and fields inside the panelFormLayout to be aligned vertically. </html:p> <html:p> When height property is defined, fixed height distribution is done, if no height is set, no height style properties to components is added. </html:p> <html:p> The tanelFormLayout component also supports the group component in its footer facet so you can place more than one item in the footer. You can even group footer items one additional time to get separators to appear. </html:p>
